website_summaries.verdict: A weather radio that can be powered in a number of ways so it can be used in emergency situations.
pros: This handy model features a solar panel, a hand crank, and a rechargeable battery, or it can be powered by 6 AA batteries
The unit also includes a flashlight, a charging port for your devices, and an ultrasonic dog whistle
cons: If you need to replace the rechargeable battery, because of the proprietary connectors, it can be a little difficult

customer_reviews.title: Rechargeable Battery Replacement Hard to Find
customer_reviews.text: It's well made and useful until you pull it out of the closet and try to use the rechargeable battery. We left it too long in the dark (I'm sure like most people) and the battery now needs replacing. Unfortunately Midland uses a proprietary type plug rather than a typical 18650 Lithium battery with terminals at each end. Try finding that battery in the photo! Guess I'll have to keep 6 AA batteries at the ready.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel C.

customer_reviews.title: Not going to be much help in an emergency power situation.
customer_reviews.text: Too many downsides: * The solar charging to too weak to even maintain a charge while sitting in a west facing window. * Hand crank no where near efficient enough to charge internal battery enough to charge a phone (I tried running down the internal battery and cranking and it was hopeless). * No way to disable the Required Weekly Test as other radios have. This means if you keep the weather alert feature on, you'll hear a loud siren and strobe light every Wednesday between 11 am and noon.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Best radio ever
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best hand crank radio out there Pros: The price is very inexpensive It comes with many features Battery size is good You got different ways to power the radio Solar is an great addition The house is solid. It sure will survive drops Sound quality is good Cons: Weight can be small problem if you wanna take it on a backpacking/hiking trip Final thoughts:Just buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Duc Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Old product, needs updating
customer_reviews.text: One star removed for difficulty with programming the radio, the fact that the hand crank doesn’t work as well as described, and our radio was defective. Three other stars removed because this is an old design, badly in need of updating. It appears the company no longer supports this product—three emails and two calls to Midland customer service have all been ignored. Thanks to Amazon for standing behind products they sell, because Midland does not.
customer_reviews.author: lakes

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working
customer_reviews.text: Owned this for less than six months. It started acting weirdly yesterday - flashlight came on by itself and wouldn’t shut off. Unplugged the battery and plugged it back in to make the light go off and now the whole thing is completely dead. It’s plugged in but shows no signs of life. Sad.
customer_reviews.author: JJpalmer

customer_reviews.title: Make sure the Lithium battery is plugged in
customer_reviews.text: I almost returned this because the Lithium battery wouldn't charge. I opened the compartment in which you can insert 6 AA batteries to find that the Lithium battery was not plugged in. I just hadn't thought about checking this because I have never bought any device that didn't have the battery connected. Once connected, it charged and everything works well. I searched and read many reviews before I bought this, so I am thankful that it all works! It's a great all-in-one device.
customer_reviews.author: tonjalr

customer_reviews.title: Horribly incompetent instructions: battery won't charge
customer_reviews.text: Bad/non-existent instructions. New out of box battery won't charge at all. Radio works when plugged in, battery indicator = full, but will not work when unplugged. No support whatsoever Wait: I figured it out: you have to find (under the crank) the battery compartment and plug in the rechargeable battery: it is not plugged in at the factory??? NOWHERE in ANY of the documentation (paper or online manual) does it tell us to do this???
customer_reviews.author: plinth garnel

customer_reviews.title: New version with better Li-Ion battery
customer_reviews.text: They’ve updated the Li-Ion battery to be a normal connector! No guarantee which version you will get as the model number is the same though.
customer_reviews.author: M. Sloan

customer_reviews.title: Radio reception was good and clear
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to condition the Lithium Ion battery so I left the light on to drain it. The battery kept the light lit for 1.5 days. NOAA emergency broadcast alert loud and gets your attention, we had one issued locally and it was so loud I shot right out of my chair. Radio reception was good and clear.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: I spent the extra money in hopes to get an excellent product. I've spent hours charging and watching videos
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't get Li-ion battery to take a charge. Even plugged in,with the Li-ion battery plugged into radio, I couldn't get it to work. Wanted to return this item, found there is a return by date. Now I'm stuck with a unusable radio. I spent the extra money in hopes to get an excellent product. I've spent hours charging and watching videos, and I called Midland in hope to get this radio set-up. Disapointed
customer_reviews.author: Shelly Orndorff

customer_reviews.title: If it only worked...
customer_reviews.text: It will not hold a charge and does not work when wound up. It worked upon arrival and not quite four months later when I might need it for a hurricane, nothing.
customer_reviews.author: MustLoveAnimals!

customer_reviews.title: Battery life sucks
customer_reviews.text: Works as described, no S.A.M.E for local only weather alerts, but no big deal. The deal breaker is the rechargeable battery. After less than two years it won't hold a charge. I dont to have to keep buying a rechargeable battery. I'm switching to AA battery powered Noaa radio. I like Midland, but the battery life sucks
customer_reviews.author: Kem

customer_reviews.title: Be Wary -- My Radio Never Charged -- Going Back to Amazon
customer_reviews.text: As some others have reported: unit never charged. Followed the instructions to a t and......charge never held Disappointed in Wirecutter for recommending this as their 'upgrade pick' -- specifically purchased knowing it was more expensive and expecting quality and performance to match....no such luck.
customer_reviews.author: E. H.

customer_reviews.title: Battery Troubles
customer_reviews.text: Bought this item after a 24 hour power outage here. When it first arrived, I checked functionality and it seemed fine, so I stuck it back in the box until the next inevitable power loss. Lo and behold, ComEd held it together for almost 2 years. Good for them, but bad for the ER210, apparently. The battery is completely dead (I accept some blame for this, as I should have been doing some maintenance), and won't accept a charge. The crank is useless, and I find out that buying a replacement might just be a waste of money, as the manufacturer decided to use a proprietary version. So, into the trash it goes. Another lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: Michael B. Healy

customer_reviews.title: disappointed
customer_reviews.text: after quite a bit of research ordered this one. mine must have been defective because after charging it, and the indicator showed full charge, it only lasted for a few minutes at best. just long enough for me to check out the features, and then it conked out. returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah

customer_reviews.title: 1000% Satisfied!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this like 5 months ago and it's been sitting in our Survival Kit since then. I charged it up when it first arrived, and threw it in the kit. I actually had to get something out of the kit the other day and just for S&G's decided to check on the radios battery life, it was still at 100% battery after 5 months of sitting in a Tote in our Closet. This is worth the buy! And obviously it'll serve its purpose in the future, because judging by current events, it's only a matter of time.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Davis

customer_reviews.title: Poor reception
customer_reviews.text: Poor reception, a waste of money. don't buy. I have 100,00 watt radio stations within 20 miles, all I get is static. Can't recievie even the closest station forget Emergency channels.
customer_reviews.author: Chile  Fanatic

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This product is everything it advertises. The hand crank works decent and would be acceptable during the night If it wasn’t charged and the is no power. During the day use the solar panel as it charges it faster. If you don’t take the protective cover off though it takes awhile to charge. The weather (wx) feature works fantastic. We can hear it through the entire house with the doors closed and this is impressive because you can’t hear a baby crying across the hallway with the doors closed. I would absolutely buy one of these for a friend or loved one.
customer_reviews.author: reviewguru

customer_reviews.title: Good radio; however, make sure set to NOAA station with good reception for alert to sound
customer_reviews.text: I amended a first review, which gave this radio 5 stars for this radio that did everything it claimed to do except my dog didn't budge with the dog whistle alert. I amended it because I had the WX alert on for some time and it did not sound last night when there was a tornado warning in my community. . It had worked in the past. I just realized, as the emergency alert sounded, that the reason it didn't sound was because the radio wasn't set to a NOAA station that received good reception. Continuing 5 star rating; however, make sure your radio is set to a channel that gets good reception or the alert will not sound.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Good emergency radio
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this emergency radio for my "go bag". Go figure, right?! I want to use it for actual emergencies. After reading a bunch of reviews on several brands and models I settled on this one. Turned out to be a good choice, It's a pretty good radio. - Sound is decent, it's an emergency radio not a $5000 stereo. - Weather channels work great - crank handle feels a bit like it could break if you treat it roughly so be careful there. - it comes with a non-standard battery. BUT, it also takes 6 AA size batteries which is awesome. the flexibility to switch between the two is very important.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Didn't pick up any weather (or AM) stations
customer_reviews.text: Bought to replace my 20-year-old Radio Shack weather radio with the broken antenna. The Midland wouldn't pick up a single weather station — just static. (The old radio got one clearly and one with static, so it's not my location.) FM stations seem OK, but that's not what I need it for....
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Kantor

customer_reviews.title: just "OK"
customer_reviews.text: The unit is good for what you need it to do and i'm sure most of the units can do the same function. I like the heavy, sturdy feel but had an issue with unit sometimes do not want to turn off (had to pull out the battery). Also the solar is a joke. I was at one bar of battery and tried charging for 3 sunny days in central florida and was still blinking at 1 bar.. disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Te

customer_reviews.title: I’m a radio enthusiast. I actually rarely buy Midland, but this Emergency Radio impresses me.
customer_reviews.text: I judge products that I buy according to whether or not they fulfill their intended purpose for their price. Having said that, I can’t find anything to complain about. It’s a well thought out design. The sound could be a bit better when compared with Sangean, but it’s decent for what it is. That’s about it. Otherwise I really like it. Well, the switch to change between the rechargeable and backup disposable battery power source is a tiny circuit-board slider that’s not easy to reach and operate, so I guess durability and longevity there may be a concern. But I would imagine that it won’t see much use.
customer_reviews.author: George Carlin's ‘Stuff’

customer_reviews.title: Poor Sound Quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought this at Wirecutter's suggestion of top-rated emergency radio. Since this was an Upgrade Pick, expected it to be near flawless. It looks good, all right. But the sound quality stinks. Had to hold it at just the right angle after multiple tries, and could fleetingly hear NOAA station. Signal came and went, so overall usefulness was Zero, and reliability during a Hurricane was Zero. Outside body was durable but poor design in that the antenna, fully collapsed, sticks out past the body..making it easy to snap off.
customer_reviews.author: Wahine

customer_reviews.title: Does not recharge
customer_reviews.text: Solar and handle do not recharge the battery — stopped working when battery went empty. Might be a dud. Waste of money. :(
customer_reviews.author: cow6oy

customer_reviews.title: Radios did not work!
customer_reviews.text: Two radios! Neither one worked inserted AA batteries, they got hot to touch! Needed them when Irma came thru!
customer_reviews.author: Betty Melcolm

customer_reviews.title: That a replacement battery costs 50% of the product
customer_reviews.text: Cost to replace the Midland battery is way out of wack to the pricing on the radio...50% of the cost ! You cannot get it at any normal battery store....I purchased mine in August of 2017.....Midland needs to do put in a EASILY replaceable battery...The radio is cool, but the customer doesn't get how tough it is too replacement the main power cell.. My thoughts are to pass on this item in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Kilrush

customer_reviews.title: Bad light switch location.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this radio to use while backpacking. It was purchased to be able to keep track of the weather that may be moving in. I like a lot of features on this radio but one thing I do know since I backpacked this past weekend, every time I stopped to take a break or have a snack the light was on. It's a very poor location for this light because the battery went from 100% charged pack to 50%, and if I didn't have sunlight to keep what battery life I had I would have to continuously crank to have power. Very bad design flaw on the light switch on this Midland radio.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel J. Welsh

customer_reviews.title: Great portable NOAA radio.  Battery life concerning.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this portable NOAA radio to use down in our storm shelter. So far, thankfully, I have not had to use it down there. I think the features are great, but I have concerns about the battery life. The battery meter is showing about 1/2 on the meter and I have only had the batteries in there for about 3 weeks. The unit is on stand-by and I am using brand new Duracell's. The radio does have additional ways to power it so I hope that it works when I really need it.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Moeller

customer_reviews.title: Has a design flaw related to saving power/avoiding battery drain, poor manufacturer customer service
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my bug out bag in 2017. I noticed recently the batteries had drained, seemingly because there is no way to cut the power completely off short of removing the batteries. There is a button that cuts power to the band (so the radio no longer plays), but there is no way to cut off the clock and other passive functions. The manufacturer’s customer service department has not responded to my email, in which I asked if I was overlooking anything.
customer_reviews.author: Krusty

customer_reviews.title: Solid choice
customer_reviews.text: Our 10+ year old weather radio gave out so it was time to purchase a new one. After ordering and returning a pretty flimsy generic chinda model we settled on this Midland. The included Quick Start guide made set up easy as the programming options are fairly straightforward. The guide is also easy to fold and tuck under the battery cover for future reference AM\FM and weather radio reception is very good. Sound quality is average, but that's not why most people purchase one of these units. One of the main selling points for us was the option to use (six) AA batteries.
customer_reviews.author: TechyNerd

customer_reviews.title: Well made, great sound clarity, very long battery life
customer_reviews.text: Excellent radio with a humongous battery life. I've kept it on my nightstand for 1.5 months, NOT plugged in, and haven't had to recharge it yet at all. In fact, it still has 3 bars. It's extremely clear, and easy to hear the stations. It looks very well made and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Field

customer_reviews.title: unable to turn off
customer_reviews.text: Read the user manual multiple times. "To turn the radio OFF, press and hold the BAND button for 2 seconds. " Music turns off but the LED display stays on. Not sure if this is intentional
customer_reviews.author: Max Mendelsohn

customer_reviews.title: No more surprise weather!
customer_reviews.text: I love this radio! I already owned one and was so happy with it that I bought another for my folks. It is perfect in size and candlelight and volume. The solar panel keeps it charged up, multiple weather channels, strobe light, SOS light, antenna. All it needs is a shoe string to tie a whistle to it for the complete package. Buy 2 - one for yourself and one for a loved one.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Good Combination of Features
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy little emergency radio. I like that it has power choices: rechargeable, alkalines, solar and crank. I like the size and design. I don't know what the dog whistle is supposed to be for, our dog just ignores it. It seems overpriced, but I did a lot of research before choosing this radio and it was the best option I found.
customer_reviews.author: S. Bower

customer_reviews.title: Worked for Hurricane Irma
customer_reviews.text: We lost power during Hurricane Irma. This provided a good charge for a cell phone and we were able to recharge the radio using solar power. Audio is clear for weather alerts and music. Well made and tough. Flashlight is bright! Not sure what use would be of the "dog whistle" feature.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!! Long Basttery hours!! Fast and easy Charging system!!
customer_reviews.text: I love the Size of product, radio sound is very loud and clear, charging system is very good, I can charge under bright light at night time. FLash light is bright. Battery runs very long hours I love this item and I will recomand to my friends. No alarm system, but it's OK. I love big and clear radio sound!!
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: First Impressions of the Midland ER 310
customer_reviews.text: I just received this radio today and was anxious to evaluate the performance. Thus far the radio does everything as advertised. A quick start guide is included as well as an owner's manual. For the most part the controls are quite intuitive and there is no real learning curve. AM and FM reception are both clear and strong. I am pleased to find the local weather channel is similarly clear and strong. The speaker quality is good considering the size, but for listening to music on the FM band I recommend headphones. The case seems to be very sturdy. I am pleased with the quality and performance of this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Pesach

customer_reviews.title: One of the best and most versatile Emergency Radios!
customer_reviews.text: Love all of the features associated with this radio, like the means for charging it, using it in conjunction with your cell phone, the emergency LED (also w/ the SOS coding), the various broadcast bands available, the dog whistle. I found this radio to be so ideal, I purchased one for my daughter (in Florida) and one for myself. FYI, I also purchased three (3) ER-210's for other friends and relatives in Florida and Maryland. Th ER-310 is far better than a previous emergency radio system I had before. I would highly recommend both Midland models and the brand name Midland.
customer_reviews.author: Cary Woods

customer_reviews.title: perfect application for storms
customer_reviews.text: Great radio, crank is pretty quick recharge, just used this during Isaias, was outside during power outage inspecting a tree that hit the house. Light is not only bright but the beam shoots a far distance like a wide laser beam. Id suggest having a seperate light (latern) for a large dispersed area.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Save your money.
customer_reviews.text: It looks good but performance is dismal at best. This is the second one. I returned the first because I did not receive any of the weather channels, and the SOS blinking light did not blink ...---... it was ...----.. that's not SOS. The flashlight , dog whistle solar charger is just an addition to a useless weather radio and is a cover up for how dab this radio really is. The lights and whistles should have been replaced with better reception, better audio and a weather radio that could actually give you the weather stations.
customer_reviews.author: John Stefanini

customer_reviews.title: Useful flashlight and radio
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my husband. It gets in several different weather band signals as well as good radio. We charge it from the same cord we charge my tablet and our flip phones on, but with the solar panel and hand crank, you are well prepared if there is a power outage - and if needed, you can charge this up and use it to charge up the flip phones. The radio gets a good clear signal, and the flashlight has a strong beam. Definitely a good product and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: satscout

customer_reviews.title: Very versatile
customer_reviews.text: Midland has included everything in a rugged, small, lightweight, reasonably priced, emergency radio. It comes with lithium batteries that can be recharged via USB, solar panel, or hand crank. It has a USB output for powering a phone. You can add 3 AA batteries if you want. It has a digital, LCD panel that shows time, radio function (band and frequency), and status of batteries. It has an LED flashlight with low and high settings, or SOS flasher. It has an extendable antenna and an ultrasonic dog whistle. I tested everything but the dog whistle (it didn't come with a dog and we don't have our own). Really impressive!
customer_reviews.author: Clinical Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Worthless after a year
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the radio a year ago and had to pull it out for a recent storm. Thing didn't work unless it was plugged into a power source. Does not hold a charge. Which defeats the point of owning this thing. Not worth going through the hassle with Midland. Into the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: A Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Mostly good emergency radio but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: With multiple ways of charging, I've never had it die on me. The only gripe I have is the weather emergency alert - there is no way (that I can find) of turning the volume down on it. That is fine if you are sleeping and it is in another room, but I don't need to be jarred out of my chair during the monthly emergency test. So I'm not using the weather alert feature, which is a shame because that is kinda why I bought it for.
customer_reviews.author: Sully

customer_reviews.title: a bit disappointed...
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed - b/c i bought another that was $10. less and better quality sound.
customer_reviews.author: Midwife

customer_reviews.title: Great little emergency radio I trust
customer_reviews.text: I would highly recommend this emergency radio/phone charger, flash light ect. Everything works perfectly as described no complaints at all. With all the choices available I chose Midland Because they do make great products and I trust them. Who wants to take a chance with off brands during a emergency? Spend a few extra bucks you never know your life could depend on it.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Hullinger

customer_reviews.title: Works well except backlight is burned out
customer_reviews.text: After a few months the backlight on the display burned out. You have to have a flashlight if you want to change stations at night. Reception is good for weather and FM radio. Battery is not easily replaceable as it has wires with a plug on it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Simmons

customer_reviews.title: great emergency weather radio
customer_reviews.text: Great for the home to monitor if something happens. I live in the country with no WIFI, internet or cell phone coverage sometimes. I'm in California so it's great for wildfires, flash floods,dam breaks charge your phone, flashlight sos light ultrasonic dog whistle am/fm radio rechargeable & can use aa batteries. hand crank to charge it.
customer_reviews.author: Craig M.

customer_reviews.title: Great emergency radio
customer_reviews.text: Needed a radio that received to NOAA weather alerts and also keeps updating on the status of severe weather. Great that it can run on a rechargeable lithium battery, 6 AA batteries or also has a crank handle to recharge the battery if there is no power.
customer_reviews.author: Crazy Lady

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's supposed to...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in March, 2020. We leave it set to provide WX alerts 24x7, which requires an expected weekly battery charge, and we haven't yet let the battery completely die. The only problem we had was the radio was charging (on an iPhone charging block) and a WX alert went off. None of the buttons were operable after that, couldn't turn off the radio, no volume or channel changes, etc.. I switched the battery setting from Li to AA and it went off. Back to Li and it's all working again, of course I had to reset the time and all. Thus far, I'd buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: CJ7Heep

customer_reviews.title: Great performance and piece of mind.
customer_reviews.text: Great performance and piece of mind! After purchasing another brand dud, positive reviews prompted me to purchase this radio, Nothing but praise for it's performance whether the notifications for weather alerts or everyday use. Weather alert is loud enough to wake the deepest sleepers and the flashing light is a bonus to prompt a reaction. I have not been disappointed with this radio!
customer_reviews.author: Greg M.

customer_reviews.title: Not for me.
customer_reviews.text: Not a well-engineered product! Complicated to operate from instructions. Rechargeable battery is limited to replacement from Midland. Rather short life from the AA batteries(6). Has some possibilities with re-doing the design, etc.
customer_reviews.author: PT

customer_reviews.title: Bad battery
customer_reviews.text: The rechargeable battery wouldn't take a charge. Worked great off the AA batteries. Pluged it in to charge over night still dead, the battery icon even showed it was charged. These EMERGENCY radios are junk for the price, this is my second radio, different brand even, that I have bought from prime. Both have been junk.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Radio
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is good and picks up our stations. Only thing is that when I charged the rechargeable battery that comes with it, I was only able to get it to charge up to 2 bars of the possible 3 bars in the display. Still happy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bright flashlight Loud radio Decent reception (depending on where it's placed) Multiple charging modes Would recommend for the
customer_reviews.text: This thing will definitely wake you up with it's Buzz Lightyear warning sounds. It's loud when you have it setup to alert to warnings in your area. One thing I wish is that I could mute it for a period of time without having to turn the alarm off, so as is whenever there is inclement weather I have to turn off the notification function and remember to turn it back on. Bright flashlight Loud radio Decent reception (depending on where it's placed) Multiple charging modes Would recommend for the price
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: WOULD NOT BUY AGAIN
customer_reviews.text: Used over a year all over the midwest and west and has terrible reception....would not buy again
customer_reviews.author: Tom R.

customer_reviews.title: Good Flashlight and Charging. Terrible Radio Reception.
customer_reviews.text: This emergency radio is easy to use and nicely laid out. The solar and crank charging seem to work well. The downside? Radio reception is terrible. So...since that is the primary purpose for purchasing this item, I’d have to say that it’s a pretty big disappointment. Without that, it’s just an emergency flashlight and USB device charger. There are much better product out there for these two purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Jason-in-UT

customer_reviews.title: This is a nice radio. The weather radio option is a handy ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice radio. The weather radio option is a handy addition. As an emergency radio it is superb. It is also great for a fixed station use. I say that because the buttons don't lend themselves to easy tuning. Being able to use batteries along with the rechargeable battery included is a nice plus. It range is very good. It'd be 5-stars with better tuning functionality or memory buttons.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sorry unit
customer_reviews.text: The radio was good at first, but we let it sit in oir house for about a year before we used it again. It will not hold a charge now. Something has happened to the batteries. It won’t even work plugged in.. I let it sit on charger for couple of days with no luck. Very disappointed in this unit. Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: A button stuck once --hit it against my hand and it has worked fine since. Probably a little plastic burr that was not found during manufacture. Awesome NOAA radio! If the battery goes to two bars-just put in the sun for 4-5 hours and it is all charged up again. I have had other NOAA radios --this is the best!
customer_reviews.author: WWR

customer_reviews.title: I do not recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: Unit never charged. I do not recommend this product. I returned the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Motor City Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Great investment for the days you wish never come
customer_reviews.text: The moment you take this radio out of its box, you know it's sturdy and well-made. So I connected the internal battery and it charged up through the USB successfully. I love the digital tuner (instead of those horrible dials) that gets me right to the broadcasting frequency of the station I want. Great AM/FM/NOAA radio reception too. My dog doesn't care for the dog whistle however. He ran away when I turned it on. lol
customer_reviews.author: Jack O'Hara

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok. It’s loud!
customer_reviews.text: Instructions should’ve been better. It’ll serve the purpose, if we can just figure it out. It bout knocked us out of bed when we were awakened by tornado warnings. We messed with it to get it to turn off, now it won’t come back on. I say, spend $20 more and get a better model. It’s sturdy, just not easy to work with barely adequate directions.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: We use this out camping.
customer_reviews.text: The stations come in clearly. I can solar charge, which seems very slow; or use batteries, or augment the rechargeable batteries with a USB charger. I bought a fold out Ryno solar USB charger and tweed the batteries using the Ryno. The Midland works very well. I've not used the flashlight function, and probably will not but I did test it. With a fully charged batter the light is very bright. The built in handles are strong. The case is strong. This should last quite a while.
customer_reviews.author: DocHolliday

customer_reviews.title: Weather Alert drains Li Btry to much
customer_reviews.text: If WX is turned on so that the radio will wake up whenever a NOAA alert goes out, plan on recharging Li battery every week. The ultra sound whistle must work--gets dogs attention but cats don't give a hoot. Only tried it at close range a few feet from the animals. Otherwise, very happy with product
customer_reviews.author: prag

customer_reviews.title: Not Highest Quality
customer_reviews.text: Plastic is cheap, not sturdy. Components are also not first rate. This radio will not stand up to prolonged field use. It is functional, but definitely not "prepper" quality. Should be half the price for what you get. The concept of a survival radio itself is a four star necessity: this cheap radio delivers that.
customer_reviews.author: Demythologizing Demythologizers

customer_reviews.title: Took a lot of cranking.
customer_reviews.text: Did not pick up AM or FM stations very well. ..but did get reception, although scratchy. Had to crank several minutes to get enough power to run radio and light. I calculated 1 minute of cranking for 5 minutes of power. Over all pleased and it will find a home in our emergency tote.
customer_reviews.author: Cat Sailor

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade from my previous Emergency Crank/Battery Radio
customer_reviews.text: I live in Florida and we have many thunderstorms, hurricanes, etc that interrupt power. This unit is easy to use, includes a flash light and can be used to recharge other devises like cell phones and camping lanterns. Great value. Can be used to alert for tornadoes, etc.
customer_reviews.author: David C Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Got this for an emergency “bug out” radio.
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for another brand that I sent back because of poor reception. This one is much better and has the ability to come on for emergency weather alerts.
customer_reviews.author: SKBorders

customer_reviews.title: good radio
customer_reviews.text: This radio looks good and has good features. I gave it a four because on the one I got the AM would not work. As I am not a novice at radio's it was not user induced. I exchanged it for another as I liked the radio. It did not feel flimsy to me. The build was good.
customer_reviews.author: Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: No family should be without some form of weather radio and power backup for cellphones
customer_reviews.text: No family should be without some form of weather radio and power backup for cellphones and other electronic gadgets, this definetly fits into the dual category: battery back up and weather radio. Going camping this weekend I will update if need be on how well it works.
customer_reviews.author: The Legendary Lingo

customer_reviews.title: Midland Quality
customer_reviews.text: Note: Radio will not broadcast while charging a USB device. Otherwise it’s a great little emergency Radio. Suggest to keep it plugged in charging on Li option all the time. So it’s always ready to go for our wild unpredictable Texas weather.
customer_reviews.author: KDK in Texas

customer_reviews.title: The ultrasonic dog whis
customer_reviews.text: MULTIPLE POWER SOURCES - The ER310 features 3 sustainable power sources to recharge your radio: Solar Panel, Hand Crank, & Rechargeable 2600 mAh Battery. SOLAR PANEL - Simply recharge the internal lithium ion battery with direct sunlight. HAND CRANK
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Kilbourne

customer_reviews.title: A lemon.
customer_reviews.text: Dog Whistle feature didn't work at all. Charging via the USB input totally incapacitated my computer.
customer_reviews.author: lawrence chan

customer_reviews.title: Difficulty finding the battery compartment
customer_reviews.text: Had trouble finding the battery compartment. It's under the hand crank. The owner's manual tells you to connect the lithium battery right off. But the manual doesn't say where the battery compartment is located.
customer_reviews.author: C. Perrin

customer_reviews.title: Solid and dependable
customer_reviews.text: This thing is certainly built well. Solid, good reception and the charge lasts a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: It’s a great addition to my emergency preparations
customer_reviews.text: Just what I wanted to use in an emergency. Easy to use with good battery life. The sound quality is good. It’s no Bose.
customer_reviews.author: Whiteknight87

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Overall, worth it. I bought it for the emergency radio... definitely works. Battery life doesn't exceed 2 bars (out of 3), and its been sitting in sunlight for a while. Uncertain if that's a known issue or not. Light is bright, crank charger works. I know this is generally popular, I can see why!
customer_reviews.author: Cody R. Kraski

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a bug-out bag
customer_reviews.text: I do not know about battery life yet since it has not run down yet. Sound quality is good enough for casual listening. With it's replaceable battery this is one to look at--no battery lasts forever.
customer_reviews.author: Tommers

customer_reviews.title: emergency must have
customer_reviews.text: this thing has really good reception! I love that it has a built in charger, hand crank and can act as a USB power device for charging other items. I take this out with me when doing overnight astronomy shoots and can pick up stations in the middle of nowhere =D It can also be used to power my phone and with the built in hand crank it will never run out of power.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Started flipping out after a year.
customer_reviews.text: Started spontaneously turning off and resetting. Too annoying to use now. Too late to have it replaced so now i have a stupid paper weight.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Emergency Kit Radio!!!
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't be more pleased with this emergency radio! Solid and well built radio with all the features you could want in an emergency radio...solar charger, hand crank charger, two types of batteries (both chargeable and disposable), emergency light plus flashing light all in a nice well built and sturdy case. Radio works extremely well and will alarm upon receiving a weather alert! Perfect radio for you emergency kit!
customer_reviews.author: Old Codger

customer_reviews.title: Solar panel - check that it works!
customer_reviews.text: We got this a few months ago and charged it up with regular electricity. We noted the battery drained quickly. The past couple of days we had it in the sunlight and it wouldn't charge. Since the whole point of this thing is to be able to use it with a solar panel for charging, I contacted Amazon who is going to issue a credit upon the product's return. Overall it was fine for that emergency device, but be sure and check all modes of charging to ensure they all work.
customer_reviews.author: kjoyce

customer_reviews.title: Works well and alarms will get your attention when their is an alert.
customer_reviews.text: I use this during storms when I'm traveling and at home and it works great. Alarms will get your attention. Weather Stations are easy to find, and it's fairly straight forward on how to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Tanto

customer_reviews.title: Maybe Helpful -- We'll See
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for a recalled product from this company. Frankly, it's not so great. The worst thing is the quality of the reception on the weather radio. Next time I'm just going to get a plug-model that will go off when there's an alert. This one might be OK AFTER you lose power (I live in Florida and recently lost power for more than 5 days). But by the time you lose power, the storm is upon you and there's little use for a weather report.
customer_reviews.author: Dukbutr

customer_reviews.title: A solar powered radio and cell phone charger. I ...
customer_reviews.text: A solar powered radio and cell phone charger. I use the usb port to charge it to full when there are reports of an impending hurricane. There are no cables provided - I use one of the many usb charges that I have accumulated. The radio cover AM, FM, WX. The WX picks up the NOAA broadcast. There is a light on the side that has three settings, one of which is flashes.
customer_reviews.author: Bob M

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this as emergency radio and early warning system. It works very well. My wife didn't appreciate the 3am wake up calls though so we took out the battery. It is only for emergency now.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Mills

customer_reviews.title: Great for emergency situations!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Everyone should buy one of these!!! Works as advertised and is amazing. Holds a charge for what seems like forever and is great for emergency situations
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Get one so you always have it
customer_reviews.text: You never want to have to use it, but your so happy when you do. Does everything you could want and more for a great price. Should be in the emergency kit for every home.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Battery life is extremely long. Had forgot about Recharging it and fully charged battery lasted at least a month. Power outage lasted 2 hours and radio as well as light worked entire timeframe on fully charged. Off and on during following month used radio and light as a test for about 4 hrs and did not hv to charge at all. This is a handy gadget!
customer_reviews.author: GeDe

customer_reviews.title: Well made, good features.
customer_reviews.text: Overall quality was good, typical of Midland products. The flashlight was fantastic. It was very bright. Having digital tuning is so much better than the knobs on the cheaper radios.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Worth a lot more.
customer_reviews.text: Excited to get it. The only drawback is the sound of the radio, it's like an older version of a transistor radio but it's ok. Everything else is top notch and the flashlight is the brightest I've seen. Easy to learn the controls, long time using batteries, and internal battery lasts for a long time and easy to charge. I'm using it for weather reports and the many power outages we have here. It's worth more than what I paid for it.
customer_reviews.author: John Jacobson

customer_reviews.title: Great for emergencies.
customer_reviews.text: Love in Sonoma County, fires and evacuations are now a yearly occurrence. This game in handy and the battery lasts awhile.
customer_reviews.author: R. L.

customer_reviews.title: Emergency backup
customer_reviews.text: Bought this radio as back up for the storm thst never came. Weather radio alerts truly get your attention. Los of dynamo cranking for small amounts of voltage, solar charges slow.
customer_reviews.author: Steven J. Smardon

customer_reviews.title: Returned it
customer_reviews.text: The unit does not understand BOM and EOM (meaning it doesn't start and stop the beginning of message and end of message) it just alerts and you have to run to it and push a button to hear the message. It also doesn't stop on its own. A number of other little quirks with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Wi

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised at the size - a great deal of functionality in such a tiny package. Got it for our trailer, will be great to take in the field when I sketch.
customer_reviews.author: O2b5ft

customer_reviews.title: Great design, lifesaving device
customer_reviews.text: This thing is super versatile. Charge your cell phone, lithium battery, charge from outlet, charge solar, charge by crank, listen to the radio, listen to emergency storm radio, and a flashlight! Was hesitant on cost but this was worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Pedro S

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: For the price, I think this is the best emergency radio on the market. This is the second one I have bought (first one I gifted)
customer_reviews.author: Mike F.

customer_reviews.title: Great Addition to your "Go Bag'
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy easy to use; simple logic / great specs Battery Life seems irrelevant as you have Solar and Crank
customer_reviews.author: Patrik Williams

product_meta.title: Midland - ER310, Emergency Crank Weather AM/FM Radio - Multiple Power Sources, SOS Emergency Flashlight, Ultrasonic Dog Whistle, NOAA Weather Scan + Alert (Red/Black)
feature_bullets: MULTIPLE POWER SOURCES - The ER310 features 3 sustainable power sources to recharge your radio: Solar Panel, Hand Crank, & Rechargeable 2600 mAh Battery. SOLAR PANEL - Simply recharge the internal lithium ion battery with direct sunlight. HAND CRANK - Recharge the radio during a power outage or anytime away from a power source. RECHARGEABLE 2600 mAh BATTERY - The rechargeable & replaceable long life battery provides up to 32 hours of radio operation. The ER310 can also be powered by 6 “AA” Batteries (Not Included) as a backup power solution.

EMERGENCY FLASHLIGHT - The SOS FLASHLIGHT BEACON flashes Morse code in an emergency scenario and the Bright CREE LED (130 Lumens) can be used to signal for help. Select the Low brightness setting to conserve battery life or the High brightness setting for maximum illumination.

NOAA WEATHER SCAN + ALERT - NOAA Weather Scan will automatically scan through 7 available weather (WX) band channels and locks onto the strongest weather channel to alert you of severe weather updates. NOAA Weather Alert will sound an alarm indicating that there is a risk of severe weather in your area. AM/FM radio is also available.
CHARGE EXTERNAL DEVICES - Quickly charge your portable devices (cell phones, tablets, etc.) using the USB charging cable (included).
ULTRASONIC DOG WHISTLE - Use the dog whistle to assist search and rescue teams in locating individuals during an emergency situation.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars897 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
